thread.title: Chrissy Teigen's Response to Beyoncé and Adele at the Grammys Was Perfect
thread.title_full: Chrissy Teigen's Response to Beyoncé and Adele at the Grammys Was Perfect

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Chrissy Teigen's Response to Beyoncé and Adele at the Grammys Was Perfect
text:
For those that weren't lucky enough to get a front row seat at this year's Grammys, Chrissy Teigen has confirmed that watching the live performances and award acceptance speeches was as emotional as you might expect.
As Beyoncé made her first public appearance since announcing her pregnancy, Chrissy led the Twitter meltdown and reacted appropriately.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below I am crying. My bey. I cannot breathe
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 13, 2017 Dead
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 13, 2017 Goodbye. pic.twitter.com/QesLtTkNZc
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 13, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "I am crying. My bey. I cannot breathe," she tweeted, before announcing that she had died and gone to heaven during the stunning performance.
Luckily, Adele's moving tribute to George Michael brought Chrissy back to life.
Major major @Adele respects. Shit happens when you actually sing live. She was incredible.
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 13, 2017 Beyonce killed me Adele gave me life I'm confused
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 13, 2017 After she gave "major major respects" to the British singer, who picked up five awards on the night, Chrissy summed up how she was feeling after watching the two stars give their all on stage.
"Beyonce killed me, Adele gave me life. I'm confused," she wrote.
And things got even more emotional during the acceptance speeches. Adele revealed that she became pregnant with her son Angelo after her big Grammys night five years ago, and for a brief moment, it looked like she was going to give her Album of the Year Grammy to Beyoncé .
As Chrissy so succinctly summed up, this year's Grammys were a lot to handle.
